tags.name: options
tags.description: • Configuration object.

tags.name: options.metadata
tags.description: • Set the metadata for this file.

tags.name: options.resumable
tags.description:
• Force a resumable upload. NOTE: When working with streams, the file format and size is unknown until it's
    completely consumed. Because of this, it's best for you to be explicit
    for what makes sense given your input. Read more about resumable uploads
    here.

tags.name: options.validation
tags.description:
• Possible values: "md5", "crc32c", or false. By default, data integrity is validated with an
    MD5 checksum for maximum reliability. CRC32c will provide better
    performance with less reliability. You may also choose to skip validation
    completely, however this is not recommended.

description.full:
Create a writable stream to overwrite the contents of the file in your
bucket.

A File object can also be used to create files for the first time.
description.summary:
Create a writable stream to overwrite the contents of the file in your
bucket.
description.body: A File object can also be used to create files for the first time.

tags.name: callback
tags.description: • The callback function.

tags.name: options
tags.description: • Optional configuration. The arguments match those passed to {module:storage/file#createReadStream}.

tags.name: options.destination
tags.description: • Local file path to write the file's contents to.

tags.name: callback
tags.description: • The callback function.

description.full: Convenience method to download a file into memory or to a local destination.
description.summary: Convenience method to download a file into memory or to a local destination.

tags.name: callback
tags.description: • The callback function.
if an expiration timestamp from the past is given.

tags.name: options
tags.description: • Configuration object.

tags.name: options.action
tags.description: • "read", "write", or "delete"

tags.name: options.contentMd5
tags.description:
• The MD5 digest value in base64. If you provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same
    value in its request.

tags.name: options.contentType
tags.description: • If you provide this value, the client must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

tags.name: options.expires
tags.description: • Timestamp (seconds since epoch) when this link will expire.

tags.name: options.extensionHeaders
tags.description: • If these headers are used, the server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values.

description.full:
Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to the file.

Reference.
description.summary: Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to the file.

tags.name: stream
tags.description: • Duplexify stream of data to pipe to the file.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: • Optional metadata to set on the file.

description.full:
startResumableUpload_ uses the Resumable Upload API: http://goo.gl/jb0e9D.

The process involves these steps:

  1. POST the file's metadata. We get a resumable upload URI back, then cache
    it with ConfigStore.
  2. PUT data to that URI with a Content-Range header noting what position
    the data is beginning from. We also cache, at most, the first 16 bytes
    of the data being uploaded.
  3. Delete the ConfigStore cache after the upload completes.

If the initial upload operation is interrupted, the next time the user
uploads the file, these steps occur:

  1. Detect the presence of a cached URI in ConfigStore.
  2. Make an empty PUT request to that URI to get the last byte written to
    the remote file.
  3. PUT data to the URI starting from the first byte after the last byte
    returned from the call above.

If the user tries to upload entirely different data to the remote file:

  1. -- same as above --
  2. -- same as above --
  3. -- same as above --
  4. Compare the first chunk of the new data with the chunk in cache. If it's
    different, start a new resumable upload (Step 1 of the first example).
description.body:
The process involves these steps:

  1. POST the file's metadata. We get a resumable upload URI back, then cache
    it with ConfigStore.
  2. PUT data to that URI with a Content-Range header noting what position
    the data is beginning from. We also cache, at most, the first 16 bytes
    of the data being uploaded.
  3. Delete the ConfigStore cache after the upload completes.

If the initial upload operation is interrupted, the next time the user
uploads the file, these steps occur:

  1. Detect the presence of a cached URI in ConfigStore.
  2. Make an empty PUT request to that URI to get the last byte written to
    the remote file.
  3. PUT data to the URI starting from the first byte after the last byte
    returned from the call above.

If the user tries to upload entirely different data to the remote file:

  1. -- same as above --
  2. -- same as above --
  3. -- same as above --
  4. Compare the first chunk of the new data with the chunk in cache. If it's
    different, start a new resumable upload (Step 1 of the first example).

tags.name: stream
tags.description: • Duplexify stream of data to pipe to the file.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: • Optional metadata to set on the file.

description.full:
Takes a readable stream and pipes it to a remote file. Unlike
startResumableUpload_, which uses the resumable upload technique, this
method uses a simple upload (all or nothing).
description.summary:
Takes a readable stream and pipes it to a remote file. Unlike
startResumableUpload_, which uses the resumable upload technique, this
method uses a simple upload (all or nothing).
